result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tory John Brown not in court, in custody.  Attorney Angel L Johnson appeared by video for Tory John Brown.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Court ordered all pre-trial documents filed by the final pre-trial court date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Conditions of bail remain in effect including turnover to Justice Point Level 5 supervision, no driving without a valid drivers license and no possession or use of firearms.

Defendant Tory John Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Angel L Johnson appeared by video for Tory John Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Bail motion by defense argued. State objects to modification of bail. Court orders cash bail amended down to $7500. Conditions of bail remain in effect including turnover to Justice Point Level 5 supervision, no driving without a valid drivers license and no possession or use of firearms. Case remains as calendared in Branch 02.

Defendant filed a letter on August 17, 2022 requesting bail modification.  Court scheduled a bail/bond hearing on September 12, 2022 at 1:30 PM in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.  Parties notified of next court date.

Defendant Tory John Brown not in court, in custody.  Attorney Angel L Johnson appeared by video for Tory John Brown.  Attorney Chad Wozniak appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested date for Status hearing. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 2.
Status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant re:  Bail Modification.  (Tory J. Brown - #2022004220, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Tory John Brown in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant Tory John Brown in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for speedy jury trial. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing by Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Filed: Original Transcript of [PRELIMINARY  HEARING (15 pages) commencing 05-11-22 by KATHLEEN WORDEN.

Defendant Tory John Brown in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant Tory John Brown in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial. For reasons stated, defense requests an adjourned date. State has no objection. Speeedy trial demand remains. Court orders case adjourned.  Jury trial scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Thomas J McClure in court, defendant Tory John Brown not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas for Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Final pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Jury trial first call 06-21-2022 at 9:00 am, Branch 2.

Attorney Thomas J McClure in court, defendant Tory John Brown not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin for Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tory John Brown in court with attorney Thomas J McClure appear in person.  Defendant Tory John Brown in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of 16CF674(Manitowoc). Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Ball .  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Tory John Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Preliminary hearing. State Public Defenders Office needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tory John Brown in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Tory John Brown in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 4 and 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
